name: Important Programming Notes
info:
Updated on 12/1/2023
To store a memory in NodeRED use global memory to store the value, so that we can call the memory elsewhere within the project.

Function 
to retrieve the memory use: example-
global.get(var1)

to set the global memory use: example-
global.set(var1,msg.payload);

name: Clock Toolbar
format:
<script id="titleScript" type="text/javascript">

$(function() {
    if($('.md-toolbar-tools').length != 0){
        loadClock();
    }else setTimeout(loadClock, 500)
});

function loadClock(){
    $('#clock').remove();
    var toolbar = $('.md-toolbar-tools');
    
    var div = $('<div/>');
    var p = $('<p/ id="clock">');
    
    div.append(p);
    div[0].style.margin = '5px 5px 5px auto';
    toolbar.append(div);

    function displayTitle(lh) {
        p.text(lh); 
    }
    
    function upTime() {
        var d = new Date();
        p.text(d.toLocaleString());
    }

    if(document.clockInterval){ 
            clearInterval(document.clockInterval);
            document.clockInterval = null;
    }
        
    document.clockInterval = setInterval(upTime,1000);
}

</script>

name: Line Chart
format:
<html>
<iframe id="myFrame" width="600px" height="300px" style = "overflow:hidden; margin:auto; border:0px solid green;"></iframe>

<script>
//NOTE, more then one chart on a page, rename in the second and following 
//templates the "myframe" variable so that every template has a unique name.
(function(scope) {
    // watch msg object from Node-RED
    scope.$watch('msg', function(msg) {
        // new message received
        var x = document.getElementById('myFrame');
        x.setAttribute('src', msg.payload); 
        });
})(scope);
</script>
</html>

name: BuildTemplate
Numbers
format:
<html>
<iframe id="myFrame2" width="600px" height="300px" style = "overflow:hidden; margin:auto; border:0px solid green;"></iframe>

<script>
//NOTE, more then one chart on a page, rename in the second and following 
//templates the "myframe" variable so that every template has a unique name.
(function(scope) {
    // watch msg object from Node-RED
    scope.$watch('msg', function(msg) {
        // new message received
        var x = document.getElementById('myFrame2');
        x.setAttribute('src', msg.payload); 
        });
})(scope);
</script>
</html>
